alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of Franklin, Jefferson, southeastern Shawnee, northern Anderson, Douglas, eastern Osage and northeastern Coffey Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 100 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Nortonville to near Clinton to 3 miles west of Waverly. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Garnett, Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, Eudora, Richland, Wellsville, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, Perry, McLouth, Pomona, Ozawkie, Nortonville, Lecompton, Waverly and Clinton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 155 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 186 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee
